intro: Lepidococca serrata, commonly known as the serrated lepidococca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Lepidococca serrata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
